author: Richard
excerpt: For today only B&H Photovideo has on sale the Delkin Devices 1.3TB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B Memory Card for only $489.99, saving you a grand total of $410!
text: For today only B&H Photovideo has on sale the Delkin Devices 1.3TB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B Memory Card for only $489.99, saving you a grand total of $410! With 1.3TB, this easily doubles as an emergency laptop system backup card that you can stuff anywhere.Key features;1.3TB Storage CapacityPCIe InterfaceMax Read Speed: 3530 MB/sMax Write Speed: 3230 MB/sRecords Raw 8K, 6K, and 4K VideoRecords High Bitrates and Frame RatesRecords Raw Photos and Rapid BurstsSerialized for Added ProtectionWater, Shock, and X-Ray ProofCan Withstand Temperature ExtremesPurchase the Delkin Devices 1.3TB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B Memory Card for only $489.99Combining reliability and performance, the 1.3TB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B Memory Card from Delkin Devices features a storage capacity of 1.3TB and is designed for professional photographers, videographers, and high-end hosts. It is well-suited for raw and continuous-burst photography as well as raw 8K, 6K, and 4K video at high bitrates and frame rates. Thanks to a PCIe interface, you'll be able to achieve maximum read speeds of up to 3530 MB/s and maximum write speeds of up to 3230 MB/s. In addition, this card features sustained write speeds of 2150 MB/s.To help facilitate card usage in almost any environment, as well as keeping your content safe, Delkin has built its BLACK Series with a rugged design that water, shock, and X-ray proof, plus resistant to temperature extremes. In order to further enhance reliability and functionality, the BLACK Series is serialized and protected by a limited lifetime warranty and a 48-hour replacement guarantee upon registration with Delkin.Please note that this card is not compatible with CompactFlash, CFast 2.0, or CFexpress Type A hosts. Purchase the Delkin Devices 1.3TB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B Memory Card for only $489.99When you purchase through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Here's how it works.
html:
For today only B&H Photovideo has on sale the Delkin Devices 1.3TB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B Memory Card for only $489.99, saving you a grand total of $410! With 1.3TB, this easily doubles as an emergency laptop system backup card that you can stuff anywhere.

Key features;

  • 1.3TB Storage Capacity
  • PCIe Interface
  • Max Read Speed: 3530 MB/s
  • Max Write Speed: 3230 MB/s
  • Records Raw 8K, 6K, and 4K Video
  • Records High Bitrates and Frame Rates
  • Records Raw Photos and Rapid Bursts
  • Serialized for Added Protection
  • Water, Shock, and X-Ray Proof
  • Can Withstand Temperature Extremes

Purchase the Delkin Devices 1.3TB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B Memory Card for only $489.99

Combining reliability and performance, the 1.3TB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B Memory Card from Delkin Devices features a storage capacity of 1.3TB and is designed for professional photographers, videographers, and high-end hosts. It is well-suited for raw and continuous-burst photography as well as raw 8K, 6K, and 4K video at high bitrates and frame rates. Thanks to a PCIe interface, you'll be able to achieve maximum read speeds of up to 3530 MB/s and maximum write speeds of up to 3230 MB/s. In addition, this card features sustained write speeds of 2150 MB/s.

To help facilitate card usage in almost any environment, as well as keeping your content safe, Delkin has built its BLACK Series with a rugged design that water, shock, and X-ray proof, plus resistant to temperature extremes. In order to further enhance reliability and functionality, the BLACK Series is serialized and protected by a limited lifetime warranty and a 48-hour replacement guarantee upon registration with Delkin.

Please note that this card is not compatible with CompactFlash, CFast 2.0, or CFexpress Type A hosts.

Purchase the Delkin Devices 1.3TB BLACK 4.0 CFexpress Type B Memory Card for only $489.99

When you purchase through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Here's how it works.
